info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 8:35PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa County through 900 PM MST... At 834 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Granite Reef Dam, or near Fountain Hills, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Scottsdale, Fountain Hills, Granite Reef Dam and Salt River Indian Community. This includes the following highways... AZ Route 87 between mile markers 178 and 193. AZ Route 202 between mile markers 14 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
